Unless you've intentionally altered your crawl configuration to reuse 
information from prior crawls, a subsequent crawl shouldn't be affected 
by how a previous crawl or Heritrix/JVM launch was terminated.

Regarding the fewer-URIs-crawled issue:

Are you using a default configuration, or can you reproduce the problem 
with a default configuration?

Does repeating the same crawl without having killed the process always 
get the expected number of URIs?

Starting with a fresh jobs directory, can you describe exactly what 
steps in what order results in a less-than-full crawl?

Regarding the pid file issue:

Is the PID file only created the first time Heritrix is launched, then 
never updated?

Are you always launching as the same user? What OS are you using?

- Gordon @ IA

On 6/7/10 5:04 AM, katare_glg wrote:
> Hello,
>
>
>        I am using Heritrix 3.1.1 version. When I start Heritrix for the first time a pid file is created. So when I need to restart Heritrix I kill the process with the pid from the heritrix.pid file.
>
> Now next time onwards the pid file is not updated. So I just issue a killall -9 java command to stop Heritrix.
>
> When I do this and restart Heritrix I have observed that the numbe of pages fetched by Heritrix goes down sometimes.
>
> For example: I have a website which has around 270 pages. But on restarting Hertirix by killing it sometimes gives me just 36 pages.
> The count remains low until I restart Heritrix by killing it a couple of times.
>
> Any reason for this?
>
> Thanks,
> Prashant Katare.
